senses.de: To happen, take place or appear
senses.ex: Accidents like this occur every day.

Tips.title: Unexpected Events
Tips.description: Use 'occur' when talking about incidents that were not planned or controlled.
Tips.example: The outage occurred during peak hours.

Tips.title: Frequency Mention
Tips.description: 'Occur' is often used to describe how often something happens.
Tips.example: Eclipses occur more often than you might think.

senses.ex: The thought didn't occur to me at the time.

Tips.title: Spontaneous Thoughts
Tips.description: Use 'occur' for ideas that come to mind without planning.
Tips.example: It occurred to me that I had left the oven on.

Tips.title: Momentary Realization
Tips.description: Often describes a sudden understanding or idea at a specific moment.
Tips.example: The solution occurred to her in the middle of the meeting.

senses.de: To exist or be present in a particular place
senses.ex: The chemical element occurs naturally in the earth's crust.

Tips.title: Natural Presence
Tips.description: Use 'occur' to talk about natural existence or presence in a habitat or environment.
Tips.example: This species of fish only occurs in freshwater lakes.

Tips.title: Scientific Context
Tips.description: 'Occur' is commonly used in scientific contexts to describe the existence of elements or phenomena.

senses.de: To take place or happen especially suddenly or unexpectedly
senses.ex: The problems occurred when mixing the two chemicals.

Tips.title: Problems Arising
Tips.description: Use 'occur' when referring to problems that appear or develop, often unexpectedly.
Tips.example: A problem occurred during the experiment.

Tips.title: Change Over Time
Tips.description: 'Occur' can describe changes or developments that happen over time.
Tips.example: Several changes occurred in the company after the merger.

Arise.wordDefinition:
Arise means to come up, to appear, or to happen because of a particular situation, scenario, or event.

This word is usually used for situations that involve disputes, conflicts, or unexpected events. For instance, problems arising due to differences in opinions among coworkers.

Arise is used for situations where problems or conflicts arise, while occur is used for general events that happen, whether significant or small.

Come about.wordDefinition:
Come about means to happen or take place as a result of something, usually a series of events or circumstances that led up to it.

It implies that there was some sort of process or change that led to the event. For example, the meeting came about because of a misunderstanding.

Come about emphasizes the process or change that led to an event, while occur simply describes the event happening without any implication of a process or change.

Develop.wordDefinition:
Develop means to create something by gradually improving it over time. For example, a photographer may develop a picture by enhancing its color or adjusting the lighting.

Develop is used when something is being improved or created, while occur describes when something happens or takes place.

Ensue.wordDefinition:
Ensue means something follows as a result of another event, action or situation.

However, if an argument ensues between the parties involved in the accident, it means the argument is a direct result of the accident.

Occur describes an event that happens by chance while ensue describes an event that follows as a direct result of another event or action.

Happen.wordDefinition:
The words happen and occur are very similar in meaning, but there is a subtle difference. Happen is usually used for things that are unplanned or unexpected.

For example, "I didn't plan to run into my old friend at the grocery store, it just happened." It suggests that something happened by chance or coincidence.

Occur is used for things that are more planned or expected, or for things that are more formal. For example, "The meeting will occur at 2 pm, so please be there on time." It suggests that something is scheduled to happen or is part of a process.

Happen is more casual and occur is more formal, but they can be used interchangeably in many situations.

Materialize.wordDefinition:
Materialize is used when something that was not previously visible or present suddenly appears or becomes real in a physical sense.

Materialize is used for something that becomes real or physically visible out of nowhere, while occur is used simply to describe something that happens or takes place, without necessarily implying any sudden or dramatic changes.

Take place.wordDefinition:
Both occur and take place mean that something is happening or happening at a certain time.

Take place usually describes a planned or scheduled event that is intentionally happening. For example, a car accident could occur on the road, while a concert or conference could take place in a specific venue.

Transpire.wordDefinition:
Transpire means to happen or to become known, typically as a result of information being shared. It is applicable when we are talking about something that has happened in secret or something that was not previously known.

For example, it transpired that the company had been involved in illegal activities.

In simpler terms, occur is used when something happens, and transpire is used when something becomes known.

This consolidation occurs with the help of a major part of the brain, known as the hippocampus.

This vital repair process mainly occurs when we're resting, especially at night while sleeping.

quotes.Text: I love the movies, and when I go to see a movie that's been made from one of my books, I know that it isn't going to be exactly like my novel because a lot of other people have interpreted it. But I also know it has an idea that I'll like because that idea occurred to me, and I spent a year, or a year and a half of my life working on it.
quotes.Title: Author
quotes.Name: Stephen King

quotes.Text: Science fiction is any idea that occurs in the head and doesn't exist yet, but soon will, and will change everything for everybody, and nothing will ever be the same again. As soon as you have an idea that changes some small part of the world you are writing science fiction. It is always the art of the possible, never the impossible.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Ray Bradbury

quotes.Text: Look, as a child growing up it occurred to me that I had everything I could have wanted: a roof over my head, education, food. All of it because my father provided... My way of giving back was being that invisible guy. Giving something back from a lifetime of taking.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Frank Sinatra Jr.

quotes.Text: The plain man is familiar with blindness and deafness, and knows from his everyday experience that the look of things is influenced by his senses; but it never occurs to him to regard the whole world as the creation of his senses.
quotes.Title: Austrian Physicist
quotes.Name: Ernst Mach

quotes.Text: I'm just going to say it: I'm pro-guilt. Guilt is good. Guilt helps us stay on track because it's about our behavior. It occurs when we compare something we've done - or failed to do - with our personal values.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Brene Brown

quotes.Text: I have this data bank garbage can in the back of my head that is an emotional collection of events that have occurred in my life.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Gary Sherman

quotes.Text: In science, the credit goes to the man who convinces the world, not to whom the idea first occurs.
quotes.Title: English Scientist
quotes.Name: Francis Darwin

quotes.Text: I spent one night in the hospital in my life. I was past 75 when that occurred.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.Text: You don't have to wait for a tragedy to occur to rush to help those in need.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Robert Kraft

quotes.Text: True life is lived when tiny changes occur.
quotes.Title: Russian Novelist
quotes.Name: Leo Tolstoy
